conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C team—I'm Parent_E. Nursery_C is my first choice, and I’m very interested in joining your community. conversation.message:
Hello Parent_E—thanks for reaching out, and we’re glad to hear Nursery_C is your first choice.

For allocation when there are multiple applicants, we follow our published priority order and then confirm placement based on availability (quota) and timely completion of the application. We don’t use additional “fit” criteria to rank families; when we’re full, we maintain a waitlist aligned with the same priority order and we contact families if a space opens.

If you’d like us to consider you for our open spot, please send an [APPLY]. Also helpful to share: your child’s age/starting date flexibility and any schedule needs (full-time/part-time), so we can confirm the place would be workable if offered.

Happy to answer any other questions about the program as well.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on our true priority list (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). They have only initiated TALK, not APPLY, so no commitment decision is required now. Given we have quota 1, we should keep the channel warm but avoid signaling an early commitment, since higher-priority parents may apply to us soon (Parent_B ranks us 2nd; Parent_C ranks us 2nd; Parent_A and Parent_D rank us last). Provide transparent process info and invite an application plus relevant details, while not promising acceptance.

Because those timelines can change quickly (e.g., paperwork completion/withdrawals), we can’t give a firm decision date today, but we will update you as soon as there is a clear opening we can offer.

In the meantime, it’s a good idea to have everything ready so we can move immediately if we’re able to extend an offer. Here is the registration/health checklist to prepare now:
1) Registration form (child + parent/guardian details)
2) Immunization record
3) Emergency contacts + authorized pick-up list
4) Any allergy/medical care plan (if applicable)
5) Consent forms (photos/outings, etc.)

If you tell us the best email address to send documents to, we will forward our forms packet/submission link straight away.

We appreciate your patience, and we will contact you promptly if we are able to move from waitlist to an offer. [TALK]

conversation.message:
Hello Parent_E—thank you for staying in close touch and for being ready to move quickly.

Yes, there are a few things you can do now to be fully “pre-cleared” on our side so that, if we reach you on the priority list, we can issue an offer with minimal delay:
1) Confirm your child’s full name + DOB (as you did) and your preferred start-date window again (earliest/latest) in one line.
2) Confirm full-time schedule (Mon–Fri) and any non-negotiable constraints (allergies/medical plan, authorized pick-up restrictions, etc.).
3) You may submit the completed registration/health forms and immunization record now via the link we sent—this helps us verify completeness in advance. (Submitting early does not imply an offer, but it does speed things up if an offer becomes possible.)

On acceptance timing: if we are able to extend an offer, we typically require same-day confirmation, and a deposit/registration fee is usually due within a short window (often 24–48 hours). If you can be on standby to confirm within hours, that’s ideal.

If you reply with (a) your email confirmation that you’ve submitted the forms (or when you plan to), and (b) your earliest start date and latest acceptable start date, we’ll mark your file as fully ready.

[TALK]
